oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Alkaloids Produced by Acremonium coenophialum in Fescue on Vascular Function in Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oliver, Jack W.
Linnabary, Robert D.
Abney, L. Kim
Adair, Henry S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: venoconstrictive potential
alkaloids
toxic fescue
saphenous vein
dorsal metatarsal artery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The purpose of our studies have been to evaulate the venoconstrictive potential in cattle of alkaloids found in toxic fescue, using an isolated vessel model (lateral saphenous vein and dorsal metatarsal artery). The method used in our studies previously has been described (Solomons, Oliver, and Linnabary, Am. J. Vet. Res., 50:235-238, 1989).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 174-175
